Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Imaging of Mitochondrial Membrane Potential (TMRM Staining)

Material used.Material Name: PINK1 Knockout Mice SN Dopaminergic Neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra (SN) dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant G309D PINK1 failed to restore hyperpolarized mitochondrial membrane potential in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant E417G PINK1 failed to restore hyperpolarized mitochondrial membrane potential in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant CΔ145 PINK1 failed to restore hyperpolarized mitochondrial membrane potential in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted using cultured SN neurons from different PINK1 knockout and wild-type mice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control to restore mitochondrial membrane potential.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons without overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: TMRM fluorescence intensity comparable to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in TMRM fluorescence intensity compared to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Imaging of Mitochondrial Morphology (Mitotracker Green Staining)

Material used.Material Name: PINK1 Knockout Mice SN Dopaminergic Neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra (SN) dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant G309D PINK1 failed to rescue mitochondrial fragmentation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant E417G PINK1 failed to rescue mitochondrial fragmentation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant CΔ145 PINK1 failed to rescue mitochondrial fragmentation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted using cultured SN neurons from different PINK1 knockout and wild-type mice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control to restore normal mitochondrial morphology.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons without overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Long thread-like tubular mitochondrial structure in ≥90% of mitochondria observed.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Fragmented mitochondria (length <1.5 μm) in ≥10% of mitochondria observed.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Imaging of Mitochondrial Superoxide (MitoSOX Red Staining)

Material used.Material Name: PINK1 Knockout Mice SN Dopaminergic Neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra (SN) dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant G309D PINK1 failed to inhibit mitochondrial superoxide formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant E417G PINK1 failed to inhibit mitochondrial superoxide formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant CΔ145 PINK1 failed to inhibit mitochondrial superoxide formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted using cultured SN neurons from different PINK1 knockout and wild-type mice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control to reduce mitochondrial superoxide levels.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons without overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: MitoSOX Red fluorescence intensity comparable to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in MitoSOX Red fluorescence intensity compared to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Imaging of ROS Formation (CM-H2DCFDA Staining)

Material used.Material Name: PINK1 Knockout Mice SN Dopaminergic Neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra (SN) dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant G309D PINK1 failed to inhibit H2O2-induced ROS formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant E417G PINK1 failed to inhibit H2O2-induced ROS formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.
PARK6 mutant CΔ145 PINK1 failed to inhibit H2O2-induced ROS formation in PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted using cultured SN neurons from different PINK1 knockout and wild-type mice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control to reduce H2O2-induced ROS formation.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons without overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DCF fluorescence intensity comparable to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons under H2O2 stress.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in DCF fluorescence intensity compared to wild-type SN dopaminergic neurons under H2O2 stress.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: MTT Assay for Neuronal Death (Rotenone Treatment)

Material used.Material Name: PINK1 Knockout Mice SN Dopaminergic Neurons
Material used.Description: Cultured substantia nigra (SN) dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PARK6 mutant G309D PINK1 failed to prevent rotenone-induced cell death in PINK1-deficient SN neuronal culture.
PARK6 mutant E417G PINK1 failed to prevent rotenone-induced cell death in PINK1-deficient SN neuronal culture.
PARK6 mutant CΔ145 PINK1 failed to prevent rotenone-induced cell death in PINK1-deficient SN neuronal culture.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple experiments were conducted using cultured SN neurons from different PINK1 knockout and wild-type mice.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control to prevent rotenone-induced cell death.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons without overexpression were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test and unpaired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability comparable to wild-type SN neuronal culture under rotenone treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in cell viability compared to wild-type SN neuronal culture under rotenone treatment.
